definitions.definition: a person that you do not know

examples.text: There was a **complete stranger** sitting at my desk.
They got on well together although they were **total strangers**.
Why should a perfect *(= complete)* stranger ever help me out?
We've told our daughter not to speak to strangers.
She remained a stranger to me.
He was a complete stranger to me.
His years abroad had made him almost a stranger with his family.
She said that I would meet a mysterious stranger.
He was tired of being accosted by strangers in the street.

definitions.definition: a person who is in a place that they have not been in before

examples.text: Sorry, I don't know where the bank is. I'm a stranger here myself.
He must have been a stranger to the town.
You're a stranger here, aren't you?
She was a stranger to the place.

definitions.definition: to be familiar/not familiar with something because you have/have not experienced it many times before

examples.text: He is no stranger to controversy.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: shortening of Old French estrangier, from Latin extraneus ‘external, strange’.
